clinical_study.brief_title: Spinal Cord White and Grey Matter Changes in Patients With Spinal Injury

oversight_info.authority: Switzerland: Swiss Association of Ethics Committees for clinical trials [Forschungsethikkommissionen der Schweiz (EK)]

brief_summary.textblock: Background Understanding the onset and progression of spinal cord disorders is an important aim in clinical neurology. An early diagnosis with consequent therapy might prevent the progression of disability.Objective To determine the structural and dynamic changes in the microstrucutre of the spinal cord and CSF, and to explore the relationships between the MRI parameters, clinical disability, and electrophysiology. Method and subjects Anatomical MRI data will be acquired in subjects with spinal cord disorders and control subjects on a 3T MRI scanner. Morphological changes will be assessed using a high axial resolution sequence, diffusion tensor imaging sequences and an optimized MPRAGE sequence. Fluid dynamics will be assessed using an optimized phase contrast sequence. Upper and lower limb function will be scored in all subjects according to the American Spinal Cord Injury Association (ASIA) impairment scale, the Graded and Redefined Assessment of Strength and Prehension (GRASSP), Walking Impairment in Spinal Cord Injury (WISCI II), and Spinal Cord Independence Measure (SCIM III). Nerve function will be measured by standard electrophysiological methods (evoked potentials, nerve conduct velocity, nerve reflexes).

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional

primary_outcome.measure: Cross-sectional white and grey matter area of the cervical cord (mm^2)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be recruited in the out- and in-patient clinic and healthy controls from the neighbor hood. The clinical examination and MRI scans occur within 2 weeks after recruitment.

clinical_study.condition: Investigating Spinal Atrophy in Patients With Spinal Injury

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients:
- Injury to the spinal cord which leads to any neurological deficits
- able to provide Informed consent
Controls:
- able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- MRI incompatible
- Neurologic or physiatric disorders
